bug.description:
It is strange. The existing lcov/gcov does not generate source files of ./ext/ folder.
Screenshot:
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82404/53790947-82cc7a00-3f6b-11e9-84e2-f2decd8e8d55.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/1193>#1193</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.

However, the time zone is not KST format. IT seems that the output format is UTC without KST because of the gbs build environment. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82404/53800170-73572c00-3f7f-11e9-95ec-75e7591cebe4.png></denchmark-link>

[Approach 1] : The test result is failed. When I tried to execute "TZ='Asia/Seoul'; export TZ" to get the Seoul time zone, This environment variable did not affect the system environment of the GBS rootFS.
About UTC time zone of lcov (genhtml command): linux-test-project/lcov@f433d02#diff-e0fa7bb3df3ef605bff92f39fe3a25e4
Use UTC to get a timezone-independent date The date is used for updating the time inside manpages. If localtime is used, the date could vary depending on the user's timezone. To enable reproducible builds, UTC is used instead. [Approach 2] : The test result is failed. In order to apply your time zone globally, you can try to do "ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia/Seoul /etc/localtime". However, in this case, you need to get a root privilege to run this statement.
Please take a look at the version. It says 0.0.3. That's pretty old. Something is still wrong with unit-test-coverage. Anyway, nnsuite.mooo.com shows recent ones correctly for now.
